    About

    How does it work? We start with the most common words from a language. Break them down letter by letter and make a list of what follows what. Then generate a new word using the same probability of one letter following another. The result is (mostly) non-dictionary pronounceable words.

    For example, If "Q" is always followed by "U" in the english dictionary. Then "Q" will be followed by "U" in your english generated name.
